chapter.title: Users
chapter.para: In PMB, the user denomination refers to the application users and not the library users, that is readers or borrowers. An user is for example : a library assistant at the issue counter, a librarian, a software administrator, ...

sect1.title: Managing users
sect1.para: The PMB users managment section will allow to create users profiles. For each user account, a userid and a password is created. PMB need at least on administrator account (superuser). This account can't be reased from within PMB.

If you have uploaded the operationnal test data set of PMB, you have moreover three additionnal accounts : librarian (user : bib, password : bib), cataloguing agent (cat ; cat) and lending agent (circ: circ)

Access rights to the various part of the software depends on the tabs. According to the access right granted (open padlock) of not (closed padlock), the corresponding tab will be shown or not. Only one exception to this rule : the backup feature is not displayed as a tab.

You can here change an user and change his password. This last feature is usefull when someone moves to another job, or when the password is lost. The user may freely change his password witthout asking the administrator to do it, by clicking on the user preferences (preferences link on the top right of the screen).
The preferences of an user, accessible by clicking on the modify button, corresponds to the user preferences accessible from the edit your account link next to the logout link.
